title: SANS FOR572 ELK VM Welcome Dashboard

panels.content:
![kibana](img/sans_dfir_logo_sm.png)  

### Welcome to The SANS FOR572 ELK (Elasticsearch/Logstash/Kibana) distribution
This VMware image was created with a basic but functional ELK configuration.  The VM will ingest various log formats, and includes several dashboards to present the data in useful formats.  Although the VM was created specifically for the FOR572 class, it is maintained as community resource.

#####To ingest data, place files in the following directories (and all subdirectories), depending on their source format:
* **Syslog files**: `/usr/local/logstash-syslog/`
    NOTE: Since syslog does not log the year of each event, create subdirectories named for the year from which the evidence was collected.  For example, Logstash will assume all files from `/usr/local/logstash-syslog/2013/` were created in the year 2013. (Note that logs created by the passivedns utility can also be read here, whether ingested from plain files or via syslog entries.)
* **HTTPD logs**: `/usr/local/logstash-httpd/`,
* **NetFlow Archives**: `/usr/local/logstash-nfarch/`
    NOTE: Archived files must be text content in a VERY specific format.  Parse nfcapd-based files to the following nfdump output format string: `$EXP_IP %das %dmk %eng %ts %fl 0 %byt %pkt %in %da` `%nh %sa %dp %sp %te %out %pr 0 0 %sas %smk %stos %flg 0`, where `$EXP_IP` is the IP address of the NetFlow exporter.  You'll also need to use hte `-N` switch to nfdump, which forces non-rolled up numbers in the output (e.g. '2048000' instead of '2 M').
* [Syslog data](index.html#/dashboard/file/syslog.json): FOR572 custom-created (includes PassiveDNS logs)
* [HTTPD logs](index.html#/dashboard/file/httpd.json): FOR572 custom-created  
* [NetFlow](index.html#/dashboard/file/netflow.json): FOR572 custom-created  
* [Original "default.json" dashboard from the logstash distribution](index.html#/dashboard/file/default.json)  
* [Sample Dashboard](index.html#/dashboard/file/guided.json) *I don't have much data yet, please extract some basics for me*  
* [Unconfigured Dashboard](index.html#/dashboard/file/noted.json) *I have a lot of data and I don't want Kibana to query it at once*  
* [Blank Dashboard](index.html#/dashboard/file/blank.json) *I'm comfortable figuring it out on my own*
panels.title: Welcome!
